marklogic.body:
Come on, it's pretty cool that Pluton's name is a clear nod to Greek mythology. "Plouton" (Cough-notacoincidence-Cough) was a god of wealth, explaining the money obsession. That or they're referencing a rock and I don't get it at all.
Ha, you make it sound like someone got knocked up by a female ox, which even Greek gods would consider a little odd! As for "Minos" it means "king" but Wikipedia says its speculated to mean "ascetic", and avoidance of worldly pleasures is something I guess a balloon-thing does quite well in a literal sense? Yep, clutching at straws. Ahem. HEY! Isn't Rokman more like a two-armed Graveller? A mid-form between the two, like when a tadpole has just the Hind legs, perhaps?
